body_html:
@PabloDIGITS
Although it may have already been settled, I will contact you in case.
If unnecessary information, please ignore below.
If the device you are using is "TX2", you can install Tensorflow1.9 with .whl at the following URL.

Python2.7
http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/redist/jp33/tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp27-cp27mu-linux_aarch64.whl

$ sudo -E pip2 install tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp27-cp27mu-linux_aarch64.whl

Python3.5
http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/redist/jp33/tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp35-cp35m-linux_aarch64.whl

$ sudo -E pip3 install tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp35-cp35m-linux_aarch64.whl

body:
@PabloDIGITS 
Although it may have already been settled, I will contact you in case.
If unnecessary information, please ignore below.
If the device you are using is "TX2", you can install Tensorflow1.9 with .whl at the following URL.

**Python2.7**
http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/redist/jp33/tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp27-cp27mu-linux_aarch64.whl
```
$ sudo -E pip2 install tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp27-cp27mu-linux_aarch64.whl
```

**Python3.5**
http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/redist/jp33/tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp35-cp35m-linux_aarch64.whl
```
$ sudo -E pip3 install tensorflow-gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.9.0+nv18.8-cp35-cp35m-linux_aarch64.whl
```
